TextBody:
Hello Justin,

Thank you for reaching out!

The way we are calculating the retention is in size of the logs.
For example - 5 logs would have approximatively 1KB while 5000 logs would have 1MB.
Please note that the size might vary from log to log but this are some general values that we use in our testing in order to determine retention of logs on the EPP client.
The reason for which we cannot provide you values based on period of time regarding retention and we prefer doing it in MB is because, retention in time represents a too hard to guess variable as it really depends on how much logs each users/customer performs/each day.


Regarding the second question,  we are sending only syslog files to the SIEM application.

Have a nice day ahead!

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.netwrix.com

-Justin
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #426878 - [STE - MPA - EPP(Prod)] Queries on EPP Server

TextBody:
Hello Justin,

Thank you for getting back to us. 

Here is the RHEL 8.3 client 
https://download.endpointprotector.com/linux_agent/EPPClient_v1.8.0.0/EPPClient_RedHatEnterprise_8.3_1805_x86_64.tar.gz

Since this is an old OS and client we strongly recommend to the customer to upgrade them, so we can provide our latest client version .

Have a nice day ahead!

Best regards,
